title: Does Time Have Its Place? Temporal Heads: Where Language Models Recall Time-specific Information
author: Yein Park (Korea University), Chanwoong Yoon (Korea University), Jungwoo Park (Korea University), Minbyul Jeong (Upstage AI), Jaewoo Kang (Korea University)
relevance_why: The exploration of temporal knowledge in language models could inform methods for improving audio-language alignment in generative systems, particularly through the lens of dynamic temporal contexts in audio generation.
background: This study investigates how language models handle facts that evolve over time, identifying specialized components (temporal heads) that enable them to recall time-specific knowledge.
contribution: This paper introduces the concept of Temporal Heads in language models to solve the challenge of accurately recalling time-variant information, achieving significant insights into their internal mechanisms.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods have focused on static fact retrieval or general knowledge representation without delving deeply into time-sensitive knowledge management.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work identifies specific attention heads dedicated to processing temporal information, improving the understanding of how models navigate changing facts.

key_innovation: Uncovers and demonstrates the existence of specialized attention heads that accurately process and recall information based on temporal context, enabling the model to differentiate between changing facts over multiple years.
real_world_impact: Enhancing time-awareness in language models can improve contextually accurate responses in applications where timing influences decisions, such as in dynamic environments like news reporting or historical data analysis.
limitations: The analysis predominantly emphasizes temporal knowledge circuits and may not fully capture the implications for broader reasoning tasks.

new_terms.Temporal Heads: **Temporal Heads** refer to specific components of language models that are exclusively activated for processing time-related knowledge, contrasting with general knowledge retrieval components.

open_sourcing: Our datasets and code are publicly available at https://github.com/dmis-lab/TemporalHead
